text: Inger-Marie Ytterhorn (born 18 September 1941) is a Norwegian politician for the Progress Party. She was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Hordaland in 1989, but was not re-elected in 1993. She later served in the position of deputy representative during the terms 1993-1997 and 1997-2001\. Her late husband Bjørn Erling Ytterhorn was also a member of the Norwegian Parliament. She is a member of The Norwegian Nobel Committee, the body that awards The Nobel Peace Prize. ==References== * Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:Progress Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:Women members of the Storting Category:Norwegian Nobel Committee Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Inger-Marie Ytterhorn
